Posts.Content: On 10/11/2008 Kittycath wrote: Absollutely!  Why? #1 YOUR anxiety!   When they found my lump I was frantic to "GET IT OUT!"  That was a Wednesday afternoon and I had the lumpectomy on Friday morning.  My long-time doctor was more than willing to get things moving for me...and that gave me a lot of comfort.   I am 4 yrs. out now--only had radiation and 4 yrs. of Tamoxifen.  I believe we MUST be proactive about our health.  Granted, you may not be able to move things up...but of course you can voice your concern--I always say, a patient IS a CUSTOMER in one sense.  I wish you luck in your endeavor to take care of that "BEAN." Kittycath did your bean hurt and was it on your breast or underarm pit?  I have a small growth and courious,  I have appt to get my mamogram this Friday.  Cathy
Posts.Title: How soon should I see a Dr?

Posts.Content: thank you all for sharing your info. I pray for all on this board often I am dealing with my Husbands stage1V c.cancer and then I find a small lump OH BOY!  not fun I went to dr he said it was nothing but I insisted for a surgeon to look at it so he gave me a referal (mine too is not just the small lump but my armpit is very sore and swelled)  I had a mamogram on 10-31 and I got results today was ok it showed benign calcifications (not sure which breast) I go to Dr again this monday and I am praying for a biopsy I totally believe in catching this early if it is nothing then I did all I could just in case.  I was too told that cancer dosn't hurt and I shouldn't worry but not satisified.  Thanks very much for all of yours and others on this boards info.  (I call this sight my therapy session)  it is very helpful & I try to help others dealing with Colon Cancer this sight makes us feel not alone. GodBless Cathy
Posts.Title: breast mri

Posts.Content: On 11/6/2008 cathyt wrote: thank you all for sharing your info. I pray for all on this board often I am dealing with my Husbands stage1V c.cancer and then I find a small lump OH BOY!  not fun I went to dr he said it was nothing but I insisted for a surgeon to look at it so he gave me a referal (mine too is not just the small lump but my armpit is very sore and swelled)  I had a mamogram on 10-31 and I got results today was ok it showed benign calcifications (not sure which breast) I go to Dr again this monday and I am praying for a biopsy I totally believe in catching this early if it is nothing then I did all I could just in case.  I was too told that cancer dosn't hurt and I shouldn't worry but not satisified.  Thanks very much for all of yours and others on this boards info.  (I call this sight my therapy session)  it is very helpful & I try to help others dealing with Colon Cancer this sight makes us feel not alone. GodBless Cathy I should have added I am 48 yrs old.  Also,  Graces daughter  I want to express my deepest sympathy I know your mom is in a better place and not suffering, keep up the goodwork with keeping yourself healthy she would want you to be healthy and live a wonderful life.  God Bless.
Posts.Title: breast mri

Posts.Content: On Apr 15, 2010 7:11 AM ibtazman wrote:  My girlfriend was just dionosed for breast cancer, but when she went in for the biopsie the doctor wanted to start her on ceamo. He had already had it set up she gets the biopse done and again was contacted by another place for ceamo she went to get her results and the doctor couldn`t even tell her what stage she is in and again pushing the ceamo. is this right? my girlfreind has been freaked out for weeks now, what do i do? Sorry your going thru this, get a second opinion is what I would do,  your Oncologist should have answers for you and if they don't seek elsewhere, most insurances are covered for another opinion & few days won't hurt will only settle your heart.  Hang in & follow your instincts, Chemo is very hard on body and you need to know everything about it b4 receiving it as well.  Prayers to you and your girlfriend. Cathy
Posts.Title: need to know what to do
